result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond M Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all the mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA within 1 year of today's date. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. DNA sampe waived, already provided.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond M Hall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raymond M Hall in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO SENTENCING
Court ordered defendant to serve 75 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 75 DAYS time served, this is a TIME SERVED DISPOSISTION. Court waived all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, but ordered defendant to pay all the mandatory court costs fees and surcharges including DNA with in 1 YEAR of today's date. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. DNA sample waived, already provided. Defendant advised of right to seek postconviction relief.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Raymond M Hall not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 23. Parties are notified that as of August 1, 2015 this case is reassigned to Br 23, Judge Grady, room 515 of the courthouse.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Raymond M Hall not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with The Marq, 2040 W. Wisconsin Avenue.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Raymond M Hall in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymond M Hall not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 7-6-2015. Defendant is in custody at Milwaukee County Jail. Both files sent to In-Custody Court.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/6/15 @ 1:30pm
